```{r}
#https://data.fivethirtyeight.com
polls_df <- read_csv("../data/polls/president_polls.csv") %>% 
  filter(!state %in% c("Maine CD-1", "Maine CD-2", "Nebraska CD-1", "Nebraska CD-2"),
         stage == "general",
         answer %in% c("Trump", "Biden"),
         !fte_grade %in% c("D+", "D", "D-", "F", "")) %>%
  drop_na(fte_grade) %>%
  mutate(weight = case_when(fte_grade %in% c("A+", "A", "A-", "A/B") ~ 3,
                            fte_grade %in% c("B+", "B", "B-", "B/C") ~ 2,
                            fte_grade %in% c("C+", "C", "C-", "C/D") ~ 1)) %>% 
  mutate(end_date = mdy(end_date),
         election_date = mdy(election_date)) %>% 
  mutate(days_out = as.duration(interval(end_date, election_date)) / (60*60*24)) %>% 
  filter(days_out <= 75) %>% 
  mutate(weight = case_when(days_out <= 14 ~ weight * 3, 
                            days_out <= 28 & days_out > 14 ~ weight * 2,
                            days_out > 28 ~ weight * 1)) %>% 
  group_by(state, answer) %>% 
  nest()%>%
  mutate(n = map_dbl(data, nrow)) %>% 
  filter (n >= 2) %>% 
  unnest() 


#don't have Wyoming, Rhode Island, Tennessee, District of Columbia, Nebraska
# but have survey monkey polls so this is what we have got 

bad_polls_df <- read_csv("../data/polls/president_polls.csv") %>% 
    filter(state %in% c("Wyoming", "Rhode Island", "Tennessee", "District of Columbia", "Nebraska",
                        "Alabama", "Connecticut", "Delaware", "Hawaii", "Idaho", "South Dakota",
                        "West Virginia", "Illinois"),
           stage == "general",
           answer %in% c("Trump", "Biden")) %>% 
  drop_na(fte_grade) %>% 
  mutate(weight = case_when(fte_grade %in% c("B+", "B", "B-", "B/C") ~ 2,
                            TRUE~ 1)) %>% 
  mutate(end_date = mdy(end_date),
         election_date = mdy(election_date)) %>% 
  mutate(days_out = as.duration(interval(end_date, election_date)) / (60*60*24)) %>% 
  filter(days_out <= 75) %>% 
  mutate(weight = case_when(days_out <= 14 ~ weight * 3, 
                            days_out <= 28 & days_out > 14 ~ weight * 2,
                            days_out > 28 ~ weight * 1))
```

```{r}
pred_df <- polls_df %>% 
  rbind(bad_polls_df)

poll_pred <- pred_df %>% 
  group_by(state, answer) %>% 
  nest() %>% 
  mutate(weighted_data = map(data, ~svydesign(id = ~1, weights = ~weight, data = .x))) %>% 
  mutate(estimates = map(weighted_data, ~as.data.frame(svymean(~pct, .x)))) %>% 
  unnest(cols = estimates) %>% 
  rename(sd = pct) %>% 
  mutate(high = mean + (2 * sd),
         low = mean - (2 * sd))

trump_poll_pred <- poll_pred %>% 
  filter(answer == "Trump")

biden_poll_pred <- poll_pred %>% 
  filter(answer == "Biden")

wide_poll_pred <- trump_poll_pred %>% 
  full_join(biden_poll_pred,
            by = "state",
            suffix = c("_trump", "_biden")) %>%
  select(state, mean_trump, mean_biden) %>% 
  mutate(dif_trump = mean_trump - mean_biden) %>% 
  mutate(map = case_when(dif_trump > 10 ~ "Solid Trump",
                         dif_trump > 5 & dif_trump < 10 ~ "Lean Trump",
                         dif_trump < 5 & dif_trump > -5 ~ "Toss-Up",
                         dif_trump < -10 ~ "Solid Biden",
                         dif_trump < -5 & dif_trump > -10 ~ "Lean Biden")) %>% 
  mutate(map = factor(map, levels = c("Solid Trump", "Lean Trump", "Toss-Up", "Lean Biden", "Solid Biden")))

plot_usmap(data = wide_poll_pred, regions = "states", values = "map", color = "black") +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("darkred","red", "yellow", "blue", "darkblue"), name = "Election Outcome") +
  labs(title = "States which Flipped in the Presidential Election",
       subtitle = "1952-1976") +
  theme_void() +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(face = "bold"))
```

```{r}
#Trump poll data
trump_polls_df <- read_csv("../data/polls_2020.csv") %>% 
  filter(candidate_name == "Donald Trump",
         stage == "general") %>% 
  #get abbreviation for merging
  mutate(state = state.abb[match(state, state.name)]) %>% 
    drop_na(state) %>%
  mutate(date = mdy(end_date)) %>% 
  # lag date a week that way we get polls from a week after to compare the numbers from (to get reaction)
  mutate(date = date - days(7)) %>% 
  select(state, date, pct)
  
# data source: https://covidtracking.com/about-data
covid_df <- read_csv("../data/all-states-history.csv") %>% 
  select(state, date, deathIncrease, totalTestsViralIncrease) %>% 
  #make it by 100 tests instead of 1
  mutate(totalTestsViralIncrease = totalTestsViralIncrease/100) %>% 
  right_join(trump_polls_df) %>% 
   #https://stackoverflow.com/questions/40581705/group-dates-by-week-in-r
mutate(week = cut.Date(date, breaks = "1 week", labels = FALSE)) %>% 
  group_by(state, week) %>% 
  nest() %>% 
  #creating means by week
  mutate(week_death_increase = map_dbl(data, ~ sum(.$deathIncrease)),
         week_test_increase = map_dbl(data, ~ sum(.$totalTestsViralIncrease)),
         weekafter_avg_pct = map_dbl(data, ~mean(.$pct))) %>% 
  unnest()

#death df
death_df <- covid_df %>% 
  #dropping all NAs as to not screw up models
  drop_na(week_death_increase) %>% 
  filter(week_death_increase >= 0) %>% 
  group_by(state) %>% 
  nest() %>% 
  #https://stackoverflow.com/questions/43787663/how-to-count-rows-in-nested-data-frames-with-dplyr
  mutate(n = map_dbl(data, nrow)) %>% 
  #rule of thumb, need at least 10 observations
  filter(n > 9) %>% 
  unnest()

#test df
test_df <- covid_df %>% 
  #dropping all NAs as to not screw up models
  drop_na(week_test_increase) %>% 
  filter(week_test_increase >= 0) %>% 
  group_by(state)%>% 
  nest() %>% 
  #https://stackoverflow.com/questions/43787663/how-to-count-rows-in-nested-data-frames-with-dplyr
  mutate(n = map_dbl(data, nrow),
         change = map_dbl(data, ~sum(.$week_test_increase))) %>% 
  #rule of thumb, need at least 10 observations
  filter(n > 9,
         #if there are states with all zeros the model doesnt work
         change > 0) %>% 
  unnest(cols = everything())
  
```

```{r}
#created model
death_mdl <- death_df %>% 
  group_by(state) %>% 
  nest() %>% 
  mutate(models = map(data, ~lm(weekafter_avg_pct ~ week_death_increase, data = .x))) %>% 
  mutate(coefs = map(models, ~coef(.x)))%>% 
  mutate(intercept = map_dbl(coefs, ~pluck(.x, "(Intercept)"))) %>% 
  mutate(slope = map_dbl(coefs, ~pluck(.x, "week_death_increase"))) %>% 
  select(state, intercept, slope) %>% 
  #need to signify what model
  mutate(type = "1 Death")

#created model
test_mdl <- test_df %>% 
  group_by(state) %>% 
  nest() %>% 
  mutate(models = map(data, ~lm(weekafter_avg_pct ~ week_test_increase, data = .x))) %>% 
  mutate(coefs = map(models, ~coef(.x))) %>% 
  mutate(intercept = map_dbl(coefs, ~pluck(.x, "(Intercept)"))) %>% 
  mutate(slope = map_dbl(coefs, ~pluck(.x, "week_test_increase"))) %>% 
  select(state, intercept, slope) %>% 
  #need to signify what model
  mutate(type = "100 Tests")

#bind for visualization
mdl_df <- rbind(death_mdl, test_mdl)
```

```{r}

#LOO for both
LOOdeath_mdl <- death_df %>% 
  group_by(state) %>% 
  nest() %>%
  #take out random row-ish
  mutate(data = map(data, ~.[-c(7), ])) %>% 
  mutate(models = map(data, ~lm(weekafter_avg_pct ~ week_death_increase, data = .x))) %>% 
  mutate(coefs = map(models, ~coef(.x)))%>% 
  mutate(intercept = map_dbl(coefs, ~pluck(.x, "(Intercept)"))) %>% 
  mutate(slope = map_dbl(coefs, ~pluck(.x, "week_death_increase"))) %>% 
  select(state, intercept, slope) %>% 
  mutate(type = "1 Death")

LOOtest_mdl <- test_df %>% 
  group_by(state) %>% 
  nest() %>% 
    #take out random row-ish
  mutate(data = map(data, ~.[-c(7), ])) %>% 
  mutate(models = map(data, ~lm(weekafter_avg_pct ~ week_test_increase, data = .x))) %>% 
  mutate(coefs = map(models, ~coef(.x))) %>% 
  mutate(intercept = map_dbl(coefs, ~pluck(.x, "(Intercept)"))) %>% 
  mutate(slope = map_dbl(coefs, ~pluck(.x, "week_test_increase"))) %>% 
  select(state, intercept, slope) %>% 
  mutate(type = "100 Tests")

LOO_death_df <- death_df %>% 
  group_by(state) %>% 
  nest() %>%
  #collect row for testing
  mutate(data = map(data, ~ slice(., 7))) %>% 
  unnest() %>% 
  right_join(LOOdeath_mdl) %>% 
  mutate(pred = intercept + slope*week_death_increase,
         dif = pred - pct) %>% 
  select(state, dif)

LOO_test_df <- test_df %>% 
  group_by(state) %>% 
  nest() %>%
    #collect row for testing
  mutate(data = map(data, ~ slice(., 7))) %>% 
  unnest() %>% 
  right_join(LOOtest_mdl) %>% 
  mutate(pred = intercept + slope*week_test_increase,
         dif = pred - pct) %>% 
  select(state,  dif)

#datawrangling for table
LOO_df <- left_join(LOO_death_df, LOO_test_df,
                    by = "state") %>% 
  arrange(dif.y) %>% 
  head(8)

LOO2_df <- left_join(LOO_death_df, LOO_test_df,
                    by = "state") %>% 
  arrange(dif.y) %>% 
  tail(8)

LOO_df <- cbind(LOO_df, LOO2_df)
```
